p: Most notably, the nasopharyngeal swab had the greatest respiratory infection pick-up with detection of 26 of the 27 viruses identified (96%). The nasopharyngeal swab did not detect one case of respiratory syncytial virus that was detected by a tracheal swab (which was considered a possible contributing factor to the death â€“ see case no. 15, Table 1). Lung tissue had the poorest detection rate, only picking up 17 of 29 respiratory infections (63%) (Table 3).
